title: Very cool
comment: Nice app

title: A must-have app
comment: I would recommend this to everyone that makes chiptunes or just likes listenning to modules. One thing, can you add .psg module support?

title: Wonderful
comment: ... remembering so many good old times. Could you add support for MO3 files please?
The main problem is that we would need an open-source, royalty-free mp3 decoder, and it doesn't exist.

title: retro goodness!
comment: great port of a must have app

title: Almost Perfect
comment: Works great, plays all my old music.  Only issue is that it seems to pause the music if ANY paired bluetooth device disconnects. If I have my phone connected to my laptop, for example, and happen to walk away, the music stops, even if my bluetooth headphones are still connected just fine.
Oops. I think the bluetooth support wasn't tested in this case. I'll get a few bluetooth devices and see what could be happening.

title: Great app
comment: I have been looking for this kind of app for such a long time and its great

title: Działa doskonale!
comment: Sam nie mogę zreplikować błędu, o którym wcześniej mówiłem, więc zgaduję, że już jest naprawiony. Jedyne, czego jeszcze mógłbym chcieć to kompatybilność z długimi (do 1024) patternami :)
Thanks. Can you send me a long module to test the player?

title: Old Skool Cool
comment: Thanks for making this, its great. 😀

title: Best Mod Player for Android
comment: Playes them all well. Decent amount of features too.

title: Veteran XMP user
comment: After using this player every day for over a year, I can say that I can't live without it :)

title: Really good player
comment: This one plays my mod files flawlessly. The only cons i have found are inconsistencies with the interface (e.g. i found no way to access the current playlist if i have paused for a while and return to the app), it does not remember my shuffle settings, and maybe the worst is huge cpu cinsumption. My phone has burnt over 20% of its battery in around half an hour for something that should be cheaper to do :). Running on SM-N900

That's interesting. The player library is 100% native code and should be very light on CPU. The visualizations, on the other hand, are Java and could drain more battery. If you're not running the visualization interface, the impact on battery shouldn't be that high. Did you change the default sampling rate or interpolation type?
Thanks for pleasure of tracker music with good usability :)

title: I wish there would be a 6 star rating.
comment: Thanks for the dev for creating the best player on android, and keeps updating it. Good job.

title: I was looking very forward for an app like this!
comment: Finally I found an app I was looking at long ago! Now I can replay all my tracker old stuff :) Works great! I am an old IT user (now Schism one in Linux) and am so pleased. THANK YOU VERY MUCH!  Cons: Maybe the interface it's poor. A flat design should be better... or a real retro one maybe :)

The current interface is the lazy one (or, more appropriately, the "I'm not a designer" one). Eventually someone will assist and we'll fix that, but until then we'll be in the "it's ugly but it works" side :)

title: XPK
comment: It would nice if this player could load XPK compressed music like Amiga players.  Edit: Thank you for the reply. It looks like you are well aware of XPK, and I hope it works out. :)
There's a XPK library, but we can't use it in libxmp because the license terms are not compatible. I'll check the feasibility of forking the library and removing/replacing the GPL parts.

title: Fantastic!
comment: I love it! Its very well put together!  Compatible with a wide variety of tracker music formats. The interface is easy to navigate, and it even includes a nice realtime view for the tracker. To top it off, the developer is kind and eager to fix bugs.
Uh-oh. please send me a couple of files that aren't playing correctly, I'll fix the player ASAP.

title: The best module player. Period
comment: I just wish the interface was nicer. SQ is top notch.
Yep, the interface is ugly. We need a designer!

title: This app just gets better and better.
comment: It's been getting better and better with each update. It's nice to still see support for mod's, s3m's, xm's and pretty much any tracker format invented, some of us still work with these formats. Thank you and well done, excellent work.

title: Great module player for Android
comment: Excellent compatibility with a variety of mod types and an overall great player

title: Does what it's supposed to and more
comment: I'm very happy to discover it comes with a way to download tracks within the app. It works like a charm on a 2011 single-core phone.

title: Good...
comment: ...but I really would like to be able to view messages in .it modules. Also, more interpolation algorithms (see OpenMPT) are welcome.
Display module messages is in the TODO list and will be worked on after we fix a few more replay bugs.

title: Best in class!
comment: I've been using this app from the start and it's gotten better and better with every update!  At first I dismissed the modarchive search and download since it didn't work, but recently I found out the problem was with the location I set for my mod directory and now it works!  It would be nice to have access to the genre filters to make it more useful. Of course, every time there's an update I always check if a couple of my problematic mods got fixed, but now I think I will send these in myself.
Please check version 4.4.0, it should include the fixes for the problems you reported.

title: Works "almost" as good as previous version
comment: Looks like my early review was a bit premature, but some files are making this application crash, but not all of them. :-) Hopefully you will see my crash reports as I send them in. Raising rating to 4, and max rating if you get it work a little better. :D (I needed to restart my old phone 2 times to make it work better again.)
I fixed a number of possible crash points in 4.4.0 based on the crash reports, I'll be monitoring the reports in case you experience more crashes.

title: Great dedicated tracker.
comment: Does pretty much all I could ask for in a mod player.

title: Awesome app.
comment: Any possible way to have a "set to ringtone" option? Also, is there a way to load up the second track or "order" (is what it is referred to in the track itself)
A ringtone generator would be interesting, let me fix a few known bugs first and we can discuss the best way to implement it.

title: Great app
comment: Some chips seem glitched - effects don't work properly,
Hi, thanks for the feedback. Please send me an email with the modules that don't play correctly so I can fix the player.
Superb!

title: Best modlar player
comment: Great player for mod's
Love this app
Excellent

title: Rocking
comment: Its so smoothing going..

title: Great Player
comment: I've used xmp(1) on Linux and BSD for years.  It's great to see it on Android with a nice UI.  Even an old POS stuck on Gingerbread with 4GB storage can hold a solid week of music with XMP and a module collection.  The playback quality is excellent as usual.

title: Nice one
comment: File selection should be done better thou.

title: Excellent tracker player
comment: The best just keeps getting better! (a cliché I know but it's true!)

title: Super awesome app!
comment: Plays almost every modules, but are missing a few. But still, this app deserves 5 stars! I love it!!

title: as usual
comment: App is perfect;) Been using xmp on pc since years, so its a must have:). as good as its linux version;)

title: Almost perfect
comment: This is really a 5 star app, but I want it to play from cloud storage to be perfect.  This would make managing songs better since it's easier to discover on a desktop vs mobile. Even better if it could tie to Mod Archive, etc.
Mod Archive search/download support is under development. Playing from cloud storage is an interesting feature and should be added in a future version.

title: Best module player on Android
comment: Awesome. Plays everything perfectly, great interface... highly recommended!

title: Best MOD player on Android!
comment: On Windows, I use XMPlay to play MOD files, and I love the "Pattern display" feature it provided. I've tried many MOD players on Android, and this one is the only one that provides the "pattern display" feature. However, it's lacking support for MO3 format that is widely used in PopCap's games.
Superb player! Only major fault i can find is lack of SNDH (Atari ST) format. It is widely used on Atari, and there is sc68 lib for android. Hint, hint! ;)

title: Great App
comment: Nice graphic design,  love the Amiga-esqe-ness of it, plays mods!

title: Best Module Player for Android
comment: No reason to ever use anything else. Plays mod, xm, it, s3m, and more, flawlessly... stability improves with every update.

title: The best!
comment: XMP is the best mod player for Android. I've been playing mods and listening to them for almost 20 years now and I really do like this application. I can't find a better app than this. It has played every format that I have thrown at it. Thanks so much I will be a user for years to come.

title: Excellent
comment: Plays tracker music flawlessly. Thx 4 app!!
Thanks! I recommend to update to 4.0.1.4, it fixes a crash in the player when you pause and skip to the next module.

title: Perfect
comment: Great

title: Best module player for android
comment: Nostalgic.. Awesome chiptune experience. Great app, responsive developer, open source, free.... What more can you ask for. Worths 10 stars.

title: best Mod/Xm app
comment: love this program. Its linked to my car Bluetooth audio. Now it Pauses on disconnection. I know The YM format is not a Mod style format but it would be excellent if you could include it one day, If interested search Leonard.oxg.free.fr.  Also love your work on the Second reality conversion.

title: Excellence
comment: Love this app

title: Very helpful developer
comment: Besides the app being very useful and working well, the developer is also fast to help out with problems.

title: Fantastic Chiptune Player
comment: I've tried many chip tune players for android and while some of them support one or two formats that Xmp does not, they pale in comparison. Xmp's channel view is particularly awesome; you can see the currently playing waveform for each channel and each can be singled out or muted individually (surprisingly uncommon among android chip players). The instrument names are displayed front and centre (great for those chipper's notes). The developer is great too; very responsive and accommodating. Simply fantastic

title: Great app!
comment: This thing supports compressed mods i.e. xmz, s3z,etc. Now if I could specify the loop count that would be awesome.

Besides xmz, s3z, etc. the player also supports gzip, bzip2, xz, lha, lzx, stonecracker, arc, arcfs. powerpacker, sqsh, mmcmp, muse (j2b), oxm, and mmcmp. Please send me an email so we can discuss the best way to implement the loop count.

title: Great mod player!
comment: Excellent work.

title: Some subsong issues
comment: I have a module with more subsongs than the list can show. Wrap the list in a ScrollView? Also, can there be an option to cycle subsongs instead of files?

Scrollview added in 3.10.1, please check if it works for you. Subsong cycling will come in a future version (I tried a quick fix but it didn't work the way I expected, so it will require more time to be implemented in the right way). Also could you send me this module with lots of subsongs so I can use it for tests?
Simply the best of Android module players

title: Great player
comment: As a protracker and octamed enthusiast this player gets thumbs up from me. Fast turn around on bugfixes too!
Thanks, please let me know if you find more bugs.

title: The best I've found for Android, but...
comment: It's the most compatible and accurate module player I've tried for Android, and the linear resampling is really clean and maintains the brightness. But I've also encountered some bugs in the playback engine. Some tempo changes aren't right, some notes play out of tone, the retrigger command (E9x on XM/MOD, don't remember the S3M/IT code) doesn't work, and sometimes you can hear detuned notes that shouldn't be audible. Otherwise, keep up the good work.
Thanks for the feedback, could you send me copies of the faulty modules so I can fix the player?

title: Well designed and functional mod player
comment: Beautifully designed mod player however I have rated it with 4 stars as there are a few popular songs in  exotic Amiga formats (TFMX, David Whittaker,  Hippel) which are not yet supported and are tricky to support that would place this app into the premier league.  Thanks to the author for listening to my feedback, quick response and regular updates.

title: The best mod player for android
comment: Indeed. Also the author is very fast in fixing bugs. I was impressed. Thank you for your job well done!
Thank you for the informative crash report. Please feel free to report any new abnormalities you may find.

title: best tracker player for android
comment: one minus - will be nice to see recursive directory playing option (hope will be implemented in near future) . + wanted convert function of the track part to mp3 for ringtones :)

I have the ringtone maker in the TODO list but at the moment there are other features with higher priority. (It may also become a stand-alone application, to avoid bundling an ogg encoder with the player.) Recursive playing also added to the list.

title: A must for any mod enthusiast
comment: Plays lots of mod formats, and has some neat features like pattern and per-channel scope views.

title: Plays all
comment: Works just great. Plays even my old XM with rare commands, which just jams other XM players.

title: Works great!
comment: Just transferred all my mods from my A1200 to my tablet.  This can play them all!  (except for the. epdir file,  which I forgot to de-select before downloading)

title: Love it!!
comment: Great, no, the best player on Android for MOD/S3M/XM/IT files :-)

title: Very good but
comment: Bug with folders with more than 6080 files or so. (Update: new version fixed this problem. It's slow but works fine.) BTW... Thank you for creating a great app. :)
Will try this scenario and fix accordingly. Did the file browser crash, or it stopped recognizing additional files?

title: Excellent
comment: The best module player on here. Great work.
The Good old days are back.
Still waiting for atari .sap file support.

title: Superb
comment: I used to love mod music so it's great to have this on my phone. Any chance of it displaying the info text from Impulse Tracker files? Was shift F9 in IT :P
Will add an option to display the info text in a future release.

title: it works!
comment: free app, no ads, thumbs up for developer~
Crashes sometimes but good otherwise

title: Brilliant
comment: Supports umx files, so I can relive the Na Pali adventure during my commute.  Feature request: the ability to automatically play each "hidden" tune after the main tune finishes.
Enable "hidden patterns" in the application settings. If that doesn't work, please contact me so we can solve the issue.

title: Great mod player
comment: New update adds sub song selection? Does this include Octamed multi modules? If so I can't work out how to do it.
OctaMED subsongs not supported yet, only subsongs made with hidden patterns are recognized in this release.

title: Been using for years...The best
comment: 2 features I would love to see 1) ability to read song message in IT files 2) a way to hide the upper song title and lower player controls when watching the scrolling notes. In landscape mode these 2 bars take up 55% of the screen! Option to hide them with the menu key please~ Great job Claudio
Song messages will be in the next release. I'll also investigate a good way to implement the "zoom mode" you mentioned.

title: excellent
comment: Nice one except it plays some xm wrong. And file association seems missing. EDIT: since the issue is fixed here's 5 stars :)
Version 3.7.0 has better XM support, give it a try! If it still fails, please contact me and send me the faulty module so I can fix the player.

title: Amazing!!
comment: Best mod player since sliced bread.

title: A gem
comment: 5 stars

title: Excellent
comment: Excellent mod player:) No problems on galaxy s4 like other's, im old enough to remember when mods were mp3s of our time mp3s were barely even heard off back then!

title: Excellent,
comment: been playing MOD files on my PC before MP3's became popular. Great to be able to do this on my Android devices as well. This app has worked flawlessly for me for years now. Thank's to the Dev for maintaining this so diligently!

title: Thanks
comment: Needed

title: I love it!
comment: Wish it had CIFS support, then it would be 10 stars!

title: Permissions?
comment: Why does this music-playing application need access to 'read phone status and identity'?
It uses PhoneStateListener to automatically pause playback when you receive a call.

title: Pretty Great
comment: Love that it has the track view. Wish there was a way to go into a playlist, turn on shuffle, select a song to play, and have it shuffle play after that song is over. Instead, it'll just play the next song in the playlist. The only way to get shuffle to work is by going into a playlist, turning on shuffle, and hitting the "play" button, so it starts with a random song. There's no way to pick a song I specifically want to hear, and have it shuffle after that.
Yes, it seems reasonable that, with shuffle mode on, it should play like that. Added to the todo list for 3.8.0

title: Just what I was looking for
comment: Had a nice collection of mod files that I was looking for a way to play. This certainly does the trick. However it would be nice to have a faster way to add many files to a playlist at once.
You can long press the current directory name and recursively add all files to a playlist. Please let me know if that does not work for you or if you need something different.
Awesome

title: Very good. Easy to use.
comment: Very good. Easy to use. No none sense apps. Get it.

title: good
comment: i like it

title: Great app for all my old tunes, 1 minor bug
comment: Reminiscing with all my old tracker tunes on my phone is awesome!  One minor bug: When XMP is paused and a phone call comes in, the player starts up again automatically after hanging up.
Oops. I think I didn't test this case, will fix it in the next release.

title: Nice app
comment: Plays most of my old modules.   I would like to have the app scan all mods for ones that it cannot play and create a list of these. Once the list was created it could give the user the option to send fornat details of those unplayable mods back to the programmer to see if the app could be updated to play then in future releases.

title: Great app
comment: Nice being able to listen to my amiga collection of music while on the move, the list of supported formats is also impressive, all the tracks I have this app has no trouble playing.

title: Best Android module player?
comment: Still would like to see MadTracker2 .mt2 format. (Format specifications on its Web site.) (Biggest possible hurdle is implementing reverb properly.)  One more suggestion: Hold directory to add to playlist.

title: Droid razr
comment: The old times has gone,but with this brilliant player has come back.I remember the impulse tracker, scream tracker xm player and a loot of them.now I can listen again old music.thanks a lot for this one.

title: Excellent module player
comment: This is a great module player that handles pretty much all of my old mods. The only thing I'd like to see added is TFMX format.
Full support to TFMX would be hard to implement, but perhaps we can add partial support. I'll check the format specs and existing players to see the feasibility.

title: Meh
comment: Plays songs just fine all right. But I don't like how I can't just navigate my paths freely or open mod files from external sources, like the file manager, or Dropbox (which is where I keep all my songs to begin with!). This makes it useless for me.
Will check how to read files from Dropbox. Opening from a file manager was supposed to work but I see it's failing in the current version, adding to todo list for the next release.

title: Fantastic
comment: Simply great

title: Best module player.
comment: Open source, too.

title: Best module player currently
comment: This is Android version of the best module player there is currently. Large amount of supported formats, good sound quality and free. :)

title: Great
comment: Great

title: old skool
comment: Play all the old Amiga mods !

title: OMG I Love This!
comment: Thank you so much!

title: Love this app because its the only one
comment: Been a fan of mods since way back in the altered perception days, almost thought the scene was dead, I was never more pleased to be mistaken! Great work on this truly worthy app.

title: Only one thing missing...
comment: This.module tracker is amazing! Plays everything perfectly, even modules with complex pattern breaks & jumps. The only thing left to do is channel mixing so that modules with left & right audio are nice through earphones.

title: Great! For all you script kiddies...
comment: Plays all your old favorite keygen tunes!

title: Wow
comment: Perfect, keep up the good work.

title: very good!
comment: the new version even plays "klisjé på klisjé" correctly, very quick response to e-mail. the file browser is a bit awkward, automatic scanning for supported files would be better

title: Excelent and still improving!
comment: Actively developed and works great. Thanks to all the devs!

title: Brilliant
comment: Plays my keygen and software crack modules flawlessly. Great work!

title: Perfect
comment: Plays mod/trackers better than neutron.

title: Works perfectly
comment: Even on MODs written back in the 90's.

title: 80s r back
comment: My MOD collection with me all the time. What more do I want?

title: Nice!
comment: Simple but good quality modfile player.

title: Great program
comment: Does pretty-much everything I want it to do, about the only other thing I could want is an option to disable case-sensitivity in the file-handling.
Interpolation is ok and love the visualization features. Wish ahx was included but it's excellent as it is.

title: Nice surprise
comment: One thing I had not expected to find. This is great! Many thanks.
Excellent app

title: Amazing app
comment: Wooow now I can play my favorite mod xm files on my phone :)

title: Filesystem troubles
comment: The filesystem is vague and requires explicit file path input instead of using a browse-to-path for establishing the playback directory.

title: Thanks - works well!
comment: Plays my collection of ~200 module perfectly!
Quality app. Increased rating to 5 stars because dev improves it with each update (both function + form). Working well on tablet and older Hero.
Amazing!

title: Browsing songs from zip archives needed
comment: Would love to see the following feature: selecting songs from within a zip archive, this saves my sdcard from having xxxx thousands of separate files from the e.g. hvsidcollection and also preserves original filenames, 5stars when this feature is added

title: Best mod player!
comment: Just awesome! Fast response on the bugfixes and suggestions too.

title: Works great
comment: I've only found a couple songs that don't play well.  I've always wanted a way to bring these songs with me since Middle School

title: Plays pretty much anything
comment: I have yet to find a module this thing can't play. It, s3m, xm, of course mod, good stuff!

title: The best!
comment: Playlist fixed after my report. Loving it. Changed from 2 to 5 stars!

title: Perfection
comment: Just perfect,do not change anything! :-)

title: Awesome mod player.
comment: This player has been awesome on road trips and at home.. good work.

title: Great
comment: But it needs a quit option. Also, is there an editor?

title: Amazing
comment: Everything I could ask for from a free module player!

title: Very cool - I like it
comment: works great on my nexus 7. reminds me of the old Atari 800 and Commodore 64 music apps.
Deadly

title: Plays great
comment: Best player
Fantastic

title: I've been looking for so long for an app such as this one...
comment: Don't know what to say about it other than this is absolutely AMAZING! Have yet to find another app that supports as many formats as this one, including but not limited to adlib and hsc formats. Works great on both my Samsung Droid Charge and my Galaxy Tab 10.1.

title: awesome
comment: good for module music makers and listeners

title: Nice!
comment: Dark background added! Thanks yet again for listening to user feedback! Still, I suggest making the 'Now Playing' screen accessible from the main app. Tapping the notification to switch tracks is not too intuitive.

title: Perfect
comment: Thanks for the dark background option. This player is now perfect!

title: Great app
comment: Has all the features of Mod player for PCs and it works well with a slow phone also.

title: excellent
comment: the best one. period

title: Nice
comment: This only player deals with Unreal umx-files. Though, not all patterns are played, sometimes only the fist one. Would be nice to have some adjustments for the sound quality.

title: Good, but won't play acorn digital symphony files
comment: A cool tracker app, but it refuses to play Acorn Digital Symphony files. Also some mod files (acorn filetype cb6) refuse to load too. All these files play ok on DigitalCD on RISC OS.

title: Works as expected
comment: Nice app

title: Nice
comment: Best mod player on the market. Wish it could scrobble but really no complaints.

title: Great App!
comment: I used to have to either bring a computer or a PDA to listen to MOD, 669 and S3M files, but now I can enjoy them on my Galaxy I-5500.

title: good.. but..
comment: often produce skipping sound on background playing...

title: Awesome
comment: Since I got my first cellphone, I wanted a mod player for it. Here it is :) The new pattern display is fantastic.

title: Oh yeah!
comment: Thank you for letting me listen to my favorite s3m's and mods!  Like having scream tracker all over again!
Works!

title: Excellent player
comment: It's an excellent player - the interface is quick and clean, and everything sounds accurate. The new visualizations remind me of classic players like Inertia. (I would like to back up Sage's request though, could you bring back the white text on black background in the song browser? It looks much better on OLEDs.)

title: Awesome app
comment: This is bringing back memories of tracking. Very well done, Sir. Keep working on improving this app. I am your fan.

title: Great mod player!
comment: Excellent player, works great. Could you please bring back the white on black background? Or make an option in the settings? Thanks!

title: Module names
comment: Bring back module names instead of file names in the browser.

title: Nice
comment: Getting better
Needs a Protracker mode so mods like AcidJazzed Evening play correctly.

title: Nostalgia!
comment: Love the latest update. Great visualizations.

title: Awesome
comment: Was rough around the edges when I first started using it, but the author has done a great job of listening to feedback and fixing/improving the app regularly.

Good player, altough it plays 
"Polarchase" (polar.mod, 116 kb) incorrectly.

title: Great player
comment: This app does what it says and does it well

title: AWESOME!
comment: I've always wanted a way to play scene files on my Android-powered phone (Samsung Galaxy S II Epic 4G Touch). This player, while basic in functionality, performs its' playback functions perfectly. I've read some of the other reviews of this software regarding playback and file format issues. Maybe it's just that I have a more recent bug-fixed version, but I have yet to encounter a playback issue or file format problem. Not bad considering my MOD collection is approaching 1 Terabyte in size.

title: Need AY support!
comment: It supports everything exept what I need! AY music format!

title: Excellent MOD player
comment: I have about 120 MOD's and a couple of XM format tunes.  This player loads them all and plays them perfectly.  Easy to build playlists and add/delete to/from them.  Good sound options, nice clean interface.  Very capable player for no money.  Only thing I wish there was are lockscreen controls, but that's minor.  Highly recommend this to anyone who wants to listen to their old-school Amiga MOD files.

title: Folder File limit?
comment: Program seems to freeze if you try to scan a folder with more than a thousand files in it. DroidSound and MODo Player list them off fine and continue to play. Otherwise, playback is pretty impressive for XM Player.

title: Does what it intends to do well enough
comment: Works fine
Total Amiga scene revival!
Did i not just post a comment?! Anyway, works great on Samsung Moment still running Cupcake (1.5), was wondering if there are any plans to support AHX

title: Fantastic-While it lasted!
comment: Loved the app!....for the short time it worked....Great sound, good info display and graphics, BUT, I had issues.  First of all, I had to manually type in the full path to my MOD files: lacks a BROWES button. Once got the path in, it played all the sample files I loaded just fine! Great. Then, the next day I tried to lauch XMP and it said it cannot find the directory I had my MOD music in. When I clicked on the Create button....CRASH! That's all she wrote. [Sorry: The application Xmp for Android (process org.helllabs, android.xmp) has stopped unexpectedly. Try Again]. Yes, the directory does exist and songs are there.   Never recovered, even after rebooting my device. Bummer. Uninstalled. I have Modo installed and it works great, but super lousy sound! Poor sampling rate you can't change.  Sammy Galaxy Player 5.0

title: Awesome module player!
comment: Great port of XMP to Android! I've been using XMP on Linux for years :) Plays a LOT of different module formats. Does an awesome job. I love not having to convert my modules to MP3 format to listen to them on the go. Nice work!

title: Splendid
comment: Love going down Retro lane with this app. Works really well! Would be nice responded to media control broadcasts so I could skip songs when locked.

title: great
comment: technolgy blows my mind!
I'm loving it
Excellent at playing the majority of Amiga based mods, but still can't play CIA timed mods properly
Great app. Playlist system is Strange but solid.
As advertised. Actually, I'd been wondering if I would find XMPlay on here (and if memory serves, this is the forerunner).

title: Nice player
comment: I love MODs so this is perfect for me and plays my tunes very well. Great stuff.
Perfect, even loops perfectly.
Inaccurate player, played a lot of wrong notes on the modules I wrote
Superb app. Very glad I came across this. Listen to my old Amiga faves on the train to work! Has all expected features.
Demoscene for life!
Very useful app. Has a few playback issues, specifically pertaining to special effects applied to notes such as portamento and arpeggio.
Good work
There are a few minor issues, like no repeat function, other than that, a neat program!
Simply amazing. Now if only this were a tracker also...
Previous and next song buttons not working properly, just stops playing. HTC hero.
This player is pure epic win!
This app just made my day.
Very cool!
Works great. Plays all my Amiga music.
Retro rules!
